name: blarghamagarky
text: like 34% of alt texts are Onstad explaining jokes and it is always hilarious

name: zapatos
text: The joke is that the cat and stuffed bear are spying on another cat who is not very familiar with computers.

name: johnnyc
text: I don't think his admittedly limited computer skills have as much to do with it as the fact that using the browser was the quickest way he could do it.

name: salo
text: Also the rayest way.

name: bixschmix
text: He used a Program.

name: ahab
text:
That's half the idea.

You also gotta realise that there's a clock ticking in the background. So that the third and fourth panel actually read (with italics being thought, and make sure you get the slow beat right:
TICK
RB "Now he's googlin' for a picture of a motorcycle"
Hmmm. Ray must be getting a new bike. Hope it won't be like last time
TICK
T "he chooses one"
That is one mad pair of wheels. But why the hell he gotta show us off like that.
TICK
RB "And shrinks the browser all down real small"
RB Oh shucks, why don't he use that macro I wrote him to do that... Wait what is he trying to do
TICK
RB T O.M.G. R.a.y.

name: tangles
text: did it possibly occur to anyone that bill mac may have very well been being sarcastic? i'm a raging asshole too, so it makes sense to me to do something like this

name: rowboat
text: Overmedicated sums it up pretty well. What other sort of person would shoot his mouth off in such a way while knowing so little about the Way Things Are? I was such a mouthy kid two months ago. It's really no wonder that there are still some people here who lame me automatically.

name: jthm_guitarist
text:
Another elusive Achewood that makes me laugh out LOUD.
Even when he knows no one is around, Ray is always doing something funny.

name: mattylite
text: I think maybe 15% of the funniness is from Teodor's lo-tech labelling of the "Ray" monitor. But 15% of infinity is, like, still infinity, right?

name: aliiis
text: Yes. I guess that I'm retarded, but when I first read this one I was thinking it was funny/awesome that Ray had labelled his own monitor 'RAY' in large, childish capitals - like as though the last three panels were a kind of 'cut to: what Ray's doing' scene. Then thought oh no, wait, remote desktop, that is just a marker for T and RB as shown in the first panel and Ray probably does not actually have an upside-down post-it note claiming his monitor as his own. Actually, I think I like to think he does. So both ways work?

name: voloshg
text: The simplicity is astounding.  Sorry, I'm new at this so I can't add to each strip as much as analyze it.
